member.name: P:IncLibrary.GoogleChartSharp.FillArea.StartLineIndex
member.summary: the index of the line at which the fill starts. This is determined by the order in which data sets are added. The first data set specified has an index of zero (0), the second 1, and so on.

member.name: P:IncLibrary.GoogleChartSharp.FillArea.EndLineIndex
member.summary: the index of the line at which the fill ends. This is determined by the order in which data sets are added. The first data set specified has an index of zero (0), the second 1, and so on.

member.summary: Create a fill area between lines for use on a line chart.

line indexes are determined by the order in which datasets are added. The first set is index 0, then index 1 etc
line indexes are determined by the order in which datasets are added. The first set is index 0, then index 1 etc

member.summary: Fill all the area under a line
member.param: an RRGGBB format hexadecimal number
line indexes are determined by the order in which datasets are added. The first set is index 0, then index 1 etc

member.name: P:IncLibrary.GoogleChartSharp.RangeMarker.Color
member.summary: an RRGGBB format hexadecimal number.

member.name: P:IncLibrary.GoogleChartSharp.RangeMarker.StartPoint
member.summary: for horizontal range markers is the position on the y-axis at which the range starts where 0.00 is the bottom and 1.00 is the top. for vertical range markers is the position on the x-axis at which the range starts where 0.00 is the left and 1.00 is the right.

member.name: P:IncLibrary.GoogleChartSharp.RangeMarker.EndPoint
member.summary: for horizontal range markers is the position on the y-axis at which the range ends where 0.00 is the bottom and 1.00 is the top. for vertical range markers is the position on the x-axis at which the range ends where 0.00 is the left and 1.00 is the right.

member.summary: Create a range marker for line charts and scatter plots

Must be between 0.0 and 1.0. 0.0 is axis start, 1.0 is axis end.
Must be between 0.0 and 1.0. 0.0 is axis start, 1.0 is axis end.

member.param: Color array to use.
CellPainting event's parameters
Percent array to show. It can be one or two. First shows bar percent and second shows target percent. If only one percent is passed and it's cero, it will fill all cell width with the glass bar.

member.summary: Create a shape marker for points on line charts and scatter plots
member.param: the index of the line on which to draw the marker. This is 0 for the first data set, 1 for the second and so on

a floating point value that specifies on which data point the marker will be drawn. This is 1 for the first data set, 2 for the second and so on. Specify a fraction to interpolate a marker between two points.
the size of the marker in pixels
